Since the story unfolds long before the events of “Outlander,” actors Sam Heughan (Jamie) and Caitríona Balfe (Claire) won’t be reprising their iconic roles.
Still, "Blood of My Blood" introduces younger versions of familiar characters. Here’s everything we know so far about the cast.
Is Claire in ‘Outlander: Blood of My Blood’?
Yes, Claire does appear in “Outlander: Blood of My Blood” but not in the way fans might expect.
The prequel dives into the love story of her parents, Julia Moriston and Henry Beauchamp, and is set in World War I, decades before Claire becomes the WWII nurse we meet in “Outlander.”
Claire's mom is pregnant in the early episodes of the series. In Episode 5, her parents come up with her name.
“Let me and this baby be your guiding light," Julia tells Henry.
Henry replies with the name "Claire" and explains why: “If it’s a girl — Claire. It’s French for clear and bright."
"Like our future," Julia responds.
Is Jamie in ‘Outlander: Blood of My Blood’?
Not yet. As of the first six episodes, Jamie Fraser doesn’t appear in the series. And for good reason. At this point in the timeline, he hasn’t been born yet.

“Blood of My Blood” follows the early relationship of Jamie’s parents, Ellen MacKenzie and Brian Fraser, in the Scottish Highlands. In the “Outlander” universe, Jamie is the youngest of their children. Ellen and Brian’s first child, William, dies young. Their daughter, Jenny is born next, followed by Jamie.
Which ‘Blood of My Blood’ Characters Are New?
“Blood of My Blood” introduces a whole new slate of characters playing Jamie and Claire's parents.
The main cast includes:
Which 'Outlander' Characters Are in 'Blood of My Blood'?
Longtime “Outlander” fans will spot several familiar characters and names that appear throughout the new series.
Further, Rupert MacKenzie appears in Episode 1 as a child and Angus Mhor appears in Episode 1 as a child.

title: Gloria Estefan Reacts to Kelly Clarkson Singing in Spanish After ‘Mi Tierra’ Duet
summary: Kelly Clarkson sang "Mi Tierra" in Spanish with Gloria Estefan on “Songs & Stories with Kelly Clarkson.”
story: Kelly Clarkson’s ability to sing in Spanish is muy bien.
The original “American Idol” winner joined Gloria Estefan in singing Estefan’s 1993 hit “Mi Tierra,” entirely in Spanish.

“I love all of your songs, but this is my favorite. This is the one I’m most excited to do today. I hope I don’t screw up the Spanish,” Clarkson told Estefan before they sang on an upcoming episode of the four-part series “Songs & Stories with Kelly Clarkson.”
“The sound of it is so different. It’s so unique. It’s so cool,” Clarkson continued.
Estefan then recounted how so many “amazing musicians” appeared on the Grammy-winning “Mi Tierra” album before Clarkson dug in her heels as they got set to perform.
“I’m very excited about this, and I hope I don’t mess it up,” she said.
The twosome then sang part of the track “Mi Tierra” and hugged after finishing.
“It wasn’t perfect but I love that song so much,” a jubilant Clarkson said.
“You are hard on yourself!” Estefan replied.
"It's not that I'm hard on myself, it's just, I love it so much—" Clarkson started
“You could be Cuban!” Estefan then joked.
Estefan's episode of “Songs & Stories with Kelly Clarkson” is airing Aug. 26 at 10 p.m. ET on NBC. The special will be available the next day on Peacock.
Upcoming episodes of the limited series will feature Teddy Swims and Lizzo. Clarkson had previously said she created the series to give fans insight into artists' stories and their music.
“Every song’s got a story, and this special gives us a chance to hear what’s behind the music straight from the artists who lived it,” she said in a press release.
“Getting to share the stage with them and hear about the moments that shaped their paths — and where they’re headed next — is pretty special.”

title: 'My Life With the Walter Boys' Season 1 Recap: 10 Things to Remember Before Season 2
summary: What to remember before My Life with the Walter Boys returns for Season 2.
story: Season 1 of "My Life with the Walter Boys" left Netflix viewers swooning when it premiered in 2023, and the series is back for more teenage drama and romance once again.
Based on Ali Novak’s 2012 novel, "My Life with the Walter Boys" follows Jackie Howard, a 15-year-old New Yorker who moves to Colorado when her family dies in a car accident.
After moving in with the Walter family, Jackie encounters change and challenges, plus a complicated. love triangle.
Before Season 2 of the series premieres on Aug. 28, we're taking a walk down memory lane to recap the highlights from Season 1.
Jackie loses her family in a tragic accident and moves in with the Walter family
Jackie Howard (Nikki Rodriguez), a freshman in high school, gets devastating news when she learns that her parents and older sister Lucy had died in a car accident.

Several months later, Jackie moves from her home in New York City to Colorado to live with her mother's close friend Katherine Walter (Sarah Rafferty), her husband George Walter (Marc Blucas) and their family.

Jackie has an uncle named Richard (Alex Quijano) who lives in New York City. But when her parents wrote their will years prior, they specified that Jackie should live with the Walter family if anything ever happened to them.
Jackie is overwhelmed as she moves in with Katherine, George and their large family, which consists of eight children (seven sons and one daughter) and two cousins from George's side of the family.

It takes her a while to adapt to the chaos and life living on a ranch. The Walter boys also make life difficult for Jackie at first with some boyish hazing, like adding bleach to her shampoo and unleashing a snake on her at the dinner table.
Jackie starts attending a new school and learns more about her new family
Jackie soon starts attending school with the Walter boys and makes friends with several of her classmates, including Skylar (Jaylan Evans) and Grace (Ellie O’Brien).
She soon learns that Cole Walter (Noah LaLonde) is ultra popular and tied up in a complicated relationship with Erin (Alisha Newton), a mean girl who is threatened by Jackie.

Cole and Erin have an on-and-off-again relationship and Cole has a tendency of straying from the relationship. One night, Jackie spots Erin's best friend Olivia (Gabrielle Jacinto) sneaking out of the ranch and realizes that Cole is a player.
Jackie and Erin clash more when Jackie joins the student council and the track team in an effort to pad her college transcript with more activities.
Over the course of the season, Jackie and Erin begin to warm up to each other.
A love triangle blossoms between Jackie, Alex and Cole
Jackie quickly connects with Alex Walter (Ashby Gentry) and romance soon blossoms.
Meanwhile, his older brother Cole Walter seems to bristle when he meets Jackie. Still, the pair has an undeniable chemistry.
Cole and Alex have some sort of sibling drama going on and Jackie soon realizes what happened between them.

As it turns out, Alex had been dating a schoolmate named Paige (Madison Brydges) — then Cole ended up hooking up with her. Cole later tells Jackie that Paige came on to him and he didn't know she was dating his brother. He insists that he would have never hurt Alex like that if he'd known.

One night, the power goes out in the Walter family's house and Jackie and Cole end up talking by the fire. Alex later walks in on what appears to be a romantic evening and is annoyed that Cole never turned the power back on. Still, nothing happened between Jackie and Cole.
Cole struggles after injuring his leg

Cole had always been a star football player at his local high school, but all that came crashing to a halt last year when he injured his leg. The teen had always assumed he'd get a college scholarship for his athletic prowess, but now realizes that he needs a new plan.
Cole works part time at a local auto shop, but considers making the arrangement full time when he realizes his college prospects are bleak.

Cole begins to spiral and drinks too much one night when his mom is receiving an important award. He causes a bit of a commotion at the awards ceremony then Jackie runs outside after him to make sure he's ok.
A drunk Cole tells Jackie he wishes she had never come to Colorado and she tells him she wishes her family never died. He later says he doesn't remember what he said since he was drinking.
Over time, Cole sees that he does have a future and he decides to attend summer school to get back on track.
The Walter family struggles financially

Running a ranch and raising a large family isn't cheap, and the Walter family learns that firsthand in Season 1. They're running dangerously low on money and get rejected from a bank when they ask for help.

George and Katherine exhaust their options trying to find a way to avoid selling the ranch. Will ends up coming up with the idea to call Jackie's uncle Richard to see if he'll invest in it. Richard is intrigued and looks forward to fleshing out the idea with Will.
Will and his fiancée Hayley take a break then get married

Will Walter, Katherine and George’s oldest son, runs into some financial struggles while planning his wedding to his fiancé Hayley (Zoë Soul). His future in-laws refuse to pay for the wedding, saying the couple is too young to marry.
When Will turns to his mom to ask for assistance, it puts the Walter matriarch in an awkward situation because she and George are struggling financially.

Will is at a crossroads in his career and he starts working at a local café, The Lark, where Hayley also works. He pitches the idea of doing a series that’s later called “Lark After Dark” to attract more nighttime customers.
Throughout the season, Will becomes so focused on work that Hayley begins to feel neglected and they end up taking a pause on their relationship.
Over time, the duo realizes they’re better off together than alone and decide to plan a wedding on the ranch. On a beautiful day, they say “I do” in front of friends and family.
Skylar and Nathan start dating

Nathan Walter (Corey Fogelmanis) develops a crush on Jackie’s friend Skylar and writes him a song to express his feelings. Skylar is put off by Nathan's directness but later decides his honesty is a good thing.
When Nathan is rushed to the hospital with seizures and is diagnosed with epilepsy, Skylar is grateful he didn’t miss out on his opportunity to date a great guy. Then, the duo starts dating.
Sparks fly between Danny and Erin
While starring in the school play with Erin, Danny begins to develop feelings for her. It’s complicated, though, since she used to date his twin brother.
When Danny gets into a summer theater program in New York City, Erin tells him he can text her to let her know how it goes.
Tara and Nik’s relationship is up in the air

School counselor Tara (Ashley Holliday Tavares) finds romance with Nik, a new English and drama teacher at Silver Falls High. Later on in the season, he gets offered a new job in London. As it turns out, he previously interviewed for the position before he met Tara.
Nik wants to take the job, but Tara is upset he doesn’t seem to be considering her feelings. She later tells him she would’ve considered moving to London with him.

At Will and Hayley’s wedding, Tara meets Jackie’s uncle Richard and they share some witty banter. That night, Nik shows up to her tent on the ranch to surprise her and tell her he turned down the job so he could stay in town.
Alex tells Jackie he loves her, then Cole and Jackie kiss
At Hayley and Will's wedding, Alex has a little too much to drink and tells Jackie he loves her. She's a bit taken aback.
Then comes a revelation about another Walter sibling.

Earlier in the season, Jackie's sister's teapot broke in an accident in the Walter kitchen. Cole repaired it but never gave it to Jackie. While talking with his twin brother, Danny (Connor Stanhope), Jackie finds a box with a notecard with name on it and realizes that Cole had fixed the teapot.

Later that day, Jackie thanks Cole for the sweet gesture and they end up kissing. The next morning, Alex goes looking for Jackie and she's gone. Surprise! She's left town and is on her way to New York City with her uncle and Danny.

title: A ‘Ferris Bueller’ Reunion! See Matthew Broderick, Alan Ruck Together Again at Ballgame
summary: "Ferris Bueller's Day Off" stars Matthew Broderick and Alan Ruck sang "Take Me Out to the Ball Game" during a break from filming "The Best Is Yet to Come."
story: Ferris Bueller is back at the ballpark.

“Ferris Bueller’s Day Off” stars Matthew Broderick and Alan Ruck reunited Aug. 24 at a minor league game in Vancouver, Canada, between the Vancouver Canadians and Tri-City Dust Devils, leading the crowd while singing “Take Me Out to the Ball Game.”
“Matthew Broderick and Alan Ruck hit it out of the park with tonight’s 7th inning stretch ⚾🎶,” the Canadians captioned a video on Instagram.

The appearance came as the duo was in town filming their new movie, “The Best Is Yet to Come.” Broderick and Ruck sang the classic tune while Ruck held a microphone in his hand as the crowd joined in. Ruck even put a twist on the lyrics to say “root, root, root for Vancouver” instead of “root, root, root for the home team.” As they wrapped up, Ruck held the microphone out for the fans, who cheered wildly.

Broderick, of course, played the title character in the classic 1986 comedy “Ferris Bueller’s Day Off,” while Ruck played his uptight best friend, Cameron. In the movie, the pair play hooky along with Ferris’ girlfriend, Sloane, played by Mia Sara, with the trio memorably taking in a Chicago Cubs game as one of their adventures.

“Ferris Bueller’s Day Off” remains a popular film, with the stars embracing the love fans have for it. Ruck revisited the Cameron character in a 2020 commercial for LiftMaster, and he reunited with Broderick in 2023 at the Season 4 premiere party for Ruck’s hit HBO series, “Succession.”
A “Ferris Bueller” spinoff, about the two valet parkers who take Cameron’s father’s car out for a joyride, is also in the works.
Broderick is comfortable knowing the film remains his signature role.
“What’s my legacy? Well, I’m Ferris Bueller, I suppose. I have to accept it. And I like it. I’ve made my peace with it,” he told The Guardian in 2023.

title: V From BTS Throws First Pitch at Dodgers Game
summary: V's first pitch at the Dodgers game was smooth like butter.
story: V's first pitch at the Dodgers game was smooth like butter.
The BTS member kicked off the Los Angeles baseball's team against the Cincinnati Reds on Monday, Aug. 25 — bringing BTS fans, known as Army, and sports fans together.
The 29-year-old singer wore a customized Dodgers jersey with No. 7 in honor of the seven BTS members, and V on the back.
Ahead of his special moment, the MLB shared video of V taking photos with Shohei Ohtani.
As the game was about to kick off, V got on the mount and then threw the first pitch. People online shared the moment, expressing their enthusiasm and happiness for the Korean singer.
The MLB also had a livestream going for people to enjoy. When he was done, he took the time to greet other people who were on the field.

When news of V’s first pitch was announced by the Dodgers, fans crashed the team’s website for tickets. StubHub even reported on Aug. 18 that ticket sales jumped five times overnight on their website after the announcement, “making the Dodgers the #1 most searched MLB team this week.”
BTS are in Los Angeles recording their first album since all members officially completed their mandatory military service in June.
All seven singers entered at different times, with V, as well as RM, enlisting on Dec. 11, 2023, per AP. Both were discharged on June 10, with Suga, the final member, completing his service June 21.
On July 1, the singers reunited on a livestream to announce they would be releasing a new album and go on tour in 2026.

“We’ll be releasing a new BTS album in the spring of next year. Starting in July, all seven of us will begin working closely together on new music,” the group said in a statement at the time. “Since it will be a group album, it will reflect each member’s thoughts and ideas. We’re approaching the album with the same mindset we had when we first started.”
They added that with the world tour, they would "be visiting fans all around the world, so we hope you’re as excited as we are.”

Since then, the singers have posted videos and photos of their time in Los Angeles as they work on their upcoming album. Their accompanying tour will be their first since “BTS Permission to Dance on Stage” concluded in 2022.

title: Watch Kevin Jonas' Wife's Tearful Reaction to His Concert Solo
summary: Kevin Jonas' first solo performance had his wife  Danielle Jonas in tears
story: Kevin Jonas nailed a career first over the weekend, and his wife's tearful reaction is a sweet display of how rewarding it is to see our loved ones shine.

At a recent Jonas Brothers concert, the 37-year-old singer claimed the spotlight with his first solo performance. The singer’s wife, Danielle Jonas, celebrated the milestone moment with an emotional post shared to Instagram on Aug. 24.
The concert, where Kevin Jonas appeared as a solo act for the first time, took place at Fenway Park in Boston, Massachusetts, on Aug. 23, according to the venue’s website.
"Last night was a moment I will never forget," Danielle Jonas wrote in the caption of the post, which featured a handful of clips and images of his performance on stage and his reaction right after.

"Hearing you sing your own song and watching your voice fill the stadium brought me to tears," she continued in the caption. "I am beyond proud of you @kevinjonas and so grateful that everyone else finally got to hear the voice I’ve loved for so long."
The first clip in Danielle Jonas' post shows the eldest Jonas Brother belting out the lyrics to his song “Changing,” with a guitar in hand.
Another video shows Danielle Jonas' reaction as she watches him from the crowd, wiping away tears as he performs.
Fans and friends of the singer filled the comments section of Danielle Jonas' post with expressions of their pride and joy for both her and Kevin Jonas.
"Kevin is finally getting his flowers," one user commented. "This post is the sweetest. So proud of him!"
Priyanka Chopra, who is married to Nick Jonas, wrote, "He was incredible. We need more Kevin Jonas, please!!!"
"We’ve all been waiting for this for 20 years!" one other user added. "I hope he continues to play this song at shows."

In a 2023 conversation on the “LadyGang﻿" podcast, Danielle Jonas and Kevin Jonas had a heart-to-heart about feeling overshadowed in their family, which, in addition to Nick Jonas, Chopra and Joe Jonas also included the latter's then-wife Sophie Turner.

“It’s also that, like, I’m out there celebrity-wise because I’ve married you,” Danielle Jonas explained to her husband. “And that’s where it’s like, I wanna have something else to my name too so that it feels, I don’t know, ‘more than,’ or like, the other girls. ’Cause then when I’m with the other girls, I feel just less than sometimes. It’s weird.”
Relating to her desire to find her place in their high-profile family and marriage, Kevin Jonas explained that he could relate to feeling “compared to the people around you the most.”
“I feel that way too,” he shared. “Nick and Joe, right? Solo careers, movies, all this stuff. It’s like, everyone has to find their place. No matter the situation, right?”
He added that for their relationship, it’s about “communicating, talking through it.”

title: Elizabeth Hurley Reveals Quirky Nickname for Billy Ray Cyrus in Birthday Post
summary: Elizabeth Hurley shared the quirky nickname she calls her boyfriend, country music star Billy Ray Cyrus, when she wished him a happy 64th birthday on Instagram.
story: Elizabeth Hurley shared the quirky nickname she calls her boyfriend, country music star Billy Ray Cyrus, when she wished him a happy 64th birthday on Instagram.
"Happy Birthday Squirrel Man," the English model and actor, 60, captioned a carousel of images of the couple she posted Aug. 25 along with four red heart emoji.

Hurley's pics include several shots of the couple holding each other closely, including one snap of them posing in front of a portrait of Hurley. She also shared a video that showed the lovebirds laughing before turning to kiss each other.
Hurley's son, 23-year-old model and actor Damian Hurley responded to her post by commenting with a row of red hearts.
Elizabeth Hurley hard launched with her romance with the "Achy Breaky Heart" singer in April 2025 when the pair shared a joint pic on Instagram that showed Cyrus kissing her on the cheek.
“Happy Easter," she captioned it.

The pair's romance began less than a year after Cyrus finalized his contentious divorce with his musician ex-wife, Firerose, in August 2024 after seven months of marriage. He was previously married to Tish Cyrus from 1993 until April 2022, and they share five children. He also shares a son, Christopher Cody, with his ex Kristen Luckey.
Hurley was previously married to businessman Arun Nayar from 2007 to 2011. She shares her son, Damian Hurley, with late businessman Steven Bing.

In May, Hurley and Billy Ray Cyrus made their red carpet debut as a couple when they attended the opening dinner for the “Orizzonti | Rosso” exhibition in Rome. Hurley's son tagged along with the couple at the event.
Hurley wore a curve-hugging hot pink gown with an attached cape, while Cyrus wore a black coat and pants that matched his dark cowboy hat.

Though their relationship has surprised some fans, it turns out Hurley and Cyrus have been friendly since they filmed the 2022 movie “Christmas in Paradise” shortly after Cyrus and Tish Cyrus separated, the singer revealed during an interview on Apple Music Country’s “The Ty Bentli Show.”

“We did very few scenes together but the couple times we were in the same scene there was a chemistry there,” he recalled of his time on set with Hurley. “We just laughed, and it was at a time I wasn’t laughing a lot.”
Billy Ray Cyrus went on to say he was touched when Hurley reached out to offer support while he was going through his divorce from Firerose.
"Of all the people to reach out to me in that second that maybe I needed most … this friend who made me laugh,” he said.
"If all we ever were (is) the friends that we are, I would take that,” he continued. “She’s so impressively brilliant. She reminds me a lot of Dolly Parton. She’s a very smart businesswoman.”
“If you can laugh together, you can make it through everything,” he added.

title: Dads Are Proudly Declaring Their Love of 'KPop Demon Hunters'
summary: "KPop Demon Hunters," a movie about a girl group who slays audiences onstage and demons offstage, has songs so infectious that dad are powerless to resist.
story: "KPop Demon Hunters," an animated Netflix movie about a girl group who slays audiences onstage and demons offstage, is packed with songs so infectious that even dads are powerless to resist.
“This movie is the perfect combo of nostalgia, earworms and never-ending streaming. So we’re screwed,” father, singer and comedian Chris Mann jokes with TODAY.com.

On Aug. 4, Mann posted a TikTok illustrating his growing obsession with the movie. Featuring the song “Golden,” the video has been viewed about 10 million times. It shows Mann going from mild interest on first watch to dramatically singing into a sword on his 10th watch.
"This is the pop culture moment of the year," he says. "It has broken the internet."
The movie has even infiltrated TODAY host Craig Melvin’s household.
“We watched it this weekend,” joked Craig on Aug. 25. “The singalong version? They’re not even giving us a chance now.”

The movie may have been initially available only on Netflix, but over the weekend it transferred to physical movie theaters, where it made about $20 million. Six songs from the movie’s soundtrack have taken over Billboard’s Hot 100 chart, with two rising into the top 10 slots, according to Billboard’s website. On Aug. 25, Netflix released a special sing-along edition on its streaming platform.
The fervor doesn't seem to be slowing down.
Mann had been watching the movie on repeat at home with his kids, but he still forked over the money to watch it in the theater with them this weekend.
"Everybody went. The whole school went," he explains. "It's almost like the school version of Taylor Swift's Eras Tour, where you don't want to miss out."

The movie has similarly been “blowing up” teacher Rob D’Urbano’s parent group chat. “Honestly, none of us mind that it’s on repeat in our houses,” he tells TODAY.com. “I feel like all the dads are enjoying it.”
Alongside a TikTok video of himself watching the movie even after his three young daughters went to bed, he wrote, “I can’t be the only parent that bops to this movie.”
No, sir. You certainly are not.
Influencer Josh Jones made a TikTok video similar to Mann's showing his evolution from skeptic to believer. He added costumes, wigs and a dance routine to really show his dedication to the film.
For Jones, it's the "message behind the movie" that really resonates.

"There's this really positive message here, where it perfectly portrays the battle between good and evil," he says. In fact, he allows the kids to watch the movie on Sunday, a day that he and his wife normally reserve for "religious" movies. He says, "It's complimented our spiritual journey as a family very nicely."

As the father of one son and five daughters — with another daughter on the way — Jones also appreciates the "girl power" theme of the movie. "Having all of these daughters, that's something that I just really want to support," he shares.
The phenomenon isn’t limited to girl dads.

Mann's two sons also love the movie. His 4-year-old sings "Soda Pop" and his 8-year-old is trying to teach himself to play the song on the piano by ear. Mann, an actor who played the title role in the the Broadway tour of "Phantom of the Opera" for 700 performances, does a mean version of "Golden."

“Something about these competing boy and girl groups is super nostalgic for millennial parents," Mann says. "We get to relive this fandom all over again through our kids. It’s like our boy band DNA meeting parenting reality.”
Mann adds, "This Halloween, it's going to be only 'KPop Demon Hunters.' I wish I had stock in this movie."

title: Malala Yousafzai Gives ‘Free Relationship Advice’ on Marrying Someone ‘Slightly Older’
summary: Malala Yousafzai posted highlights from a trip to see Oasis with husband Asser Malik and gave "free relationship advice" for marrying someone slightly older.
story: Malala Yousafzai is sharing one of the perks that can come from a relationship with an age gap — even a slight one.
The 28-year-old activist shared an Instagram reel with husband Asser Malik, 34, sharing snippets from their trip to Dublin, Ireland.
"Here's some free relationship advice: If you marry someone slightly older, like I did, you will suddenly be at legendary rock concerts,” she began in the clip.
“And I will admit,” she continued, “Oasis in Dublin ended up being a show I loved as much as Asser.”
Yousafzai described the evening at Croke Park as “80,000 people singing ‘Wonderwall’ in unison, fireworks lighting up the sky,” adding, “Dublin you are magic.”

In the brief video, Yousafzai detailed more moments their eventful getaway, sharing that they “hopped on a plane to Dublin to see some beautiful scenery, a quick morning hike, around to see Cliffs of Howth, taking in the ocean.”
She and her husband grabbed some seafood in a beachside village before heading to the historic library at Trinity College.
“Everywhere we went, the Irish people were just so warm. They made us feel immediately at home,” she gushed.
The Nobel Peace Prize winner captioned the video, “Definitely maybe an amazing weekend in Dublin: laughter in its pubs, wisdom in its library and fireworks in its skies.”
In response to one commenter who asked how her trip is related to marrying someone older, Yousafzai said, “Because Oasis released their first three albums before I was born!” with a laughing emoji.
Malik shared a selfie from the night on his own Instagram page, writing that Oasis was the "soundtrack of my teenage years" growing up in Pakistan.
“It felt surreal to finally see them live- made even better by sharing it with the one person I’d want right there beside me,” he wrote with a red heart emoji.

The Oasis concert in Dublin comes about one year after Yousafzai attended her “first-ever proper concert.” She and Malik saw Taylor Swift perform during her legendary "Eras Tour" at London’s Wembley Stadium in August 2024.

At the time, the Pakistan native shared a carousel of photos on Instagram and penned a powerful message about how "music no longer plays on the streets, and girls and women are barred from school, work and public life" after the Taliban regained power in Afghanistan.
“One day I hope we will live in a world where every girl will be able to enjoy music and live out her wildest dreams,” she wrote.
Yousafzai frequently posts about traveling, watching sports and enjoying life with Malik, whom she married in November 2021.
When the “Barbie” movie was released in July 2023, the two posed for a photo inside a faux doll box while Yousafzai poked fun at Barbie’s catch phrase in the caption.
“This Barbie has a Nobel Prize. He’s just Ken,” she joked. “We loved the movie, it was so funny and thoughtful I hope this caption doesn’t hurt all the Kens as much as the movie Ken.”
In March 2023, the couple attended the Oscars in support of a film she executive produced called “Stranger at the Gate,” which was nominated for best documentary short.
In a social media post, she boasted about her husband’s red carpet garb, writing that he was “looking handsome as ever in his tux.”
CORRECTION: (Aug. 25, 2025, 4:34 p.m. ET): An earlier version of this article mislabeled Asser Malik's age as 31. He was born Sept. 15, 1990, making him 34. This has since been corrected.)

title: Jess Walton Honors Late Tristan Rogers Ahead of His Final 'Young and the Restless' Appearance
summary: Jess Walton honors late soap star Tristan Rogers as his final ‘Young and the Restless’ appearance airs following his death at 79.
story: Fans of daytime soap star Tristan Rogers will have a chance to watch the late actor make a posthumous appearance on "The Young and the Restless."

The show's official Instagram account announced Aug. 25 that Rogers, who died Aug. 15 of lung cancer at age 79, would appear in one final scene as his “Y&R” character Colin Atkinson on the Aug. 26 episode of the show.
Rogers played the character from 2010 to 2019 in between his stints as Robert Scorpio on "General Hospital."
The series also shared a video tribute from Rogers' longtime costar Jess Walton, who portrayed Jill Abbott, the on-off love of Rogers' conniving character.

“Tristan Rogers was a respected member of the soap opera community, and he was a beloved member of 'The Young and the Restless' family,” Walton said. “I had the pleasure of being his scene partner for many years. I adored working with him.”
The video included an emotional throwback scene between the two actors from 2014 that showed their characters provoking each other as sparks fly between them.
Walton concluded the tribute, "We will miss you, Tristan, and your remarkable performance as Colin Atkinson."
Rogers died less than a month after he was diagnosed with cancer.

The actor's rep told Deadline in a statement at the time, “While he remains hopeful and is working closely with his medical team on a treatment plan, this is a challenging time for Tristan and his family.”
Rogers also returned to "General Hospital" this summer to tape a final appearance as Robert Scorpio that aired in July, Soap Opera Digest reported.

Rogers took on the role of Scorpio in 1980 and left when the character was killed off in 1992. Even after Scorpio’s on-screen death, Rogers returned as the character’s ghost until Scorpio was revealed to be alive in 2006.

Frank Valentini, the executive producer of “General Hospital,” honored Rogers in a statement after his death. “The entire General Hospital family is heartbroken to hear of Tristan Rogers’ passing," the statement said, in part.

“Tristan has captivated our fans for more than 50 years and Port Charles will not be the same without him (or Robert Scorpio),” it added. “I would like to extend my deepest sympathies to his family and friends during this difficult time. Tristan was a one-of-a-kind talent and will be greatly missed. May he rest in peace.”

title: Which 'Love Island USA' Couples Are Still Together Now?
summary: Wondering which 'Love Island USA' couples lasted? Here's an updated list of who’s still dating and who’s split since leaving the villa.
story: Maybe the real real prize on "Love Island USA" wasn't the $100,000, but the opportunity to find a connection that could survive beyond the Fiji villa's sun-soaked bubble.
When the cameras stop rolling, though, how many couples actually last?

Some "Love Island USA" couples have defied the odds, turning their villa romance into lasting love stories that include engagements, shared apartments, and anniversary posts that make us believe in reality TV romance again.
Others? Well, let’s just say not every "Love Island" love story gets a fairytale ending.
Here's a recap of the couples from "Love Island USA" who are still together — as far as we know.
'Love Island USA' Seasons 1 to 4 Couples
Unfortunately, love did not last for the couples who continued their relationships outside the villa from 'Love Island USA' Seasons 1 through 4.

Fan favorite duos like Zac Mirabelli and Elizabeth Weber (Season 1 winners), Justine Ndiba and Caleb Corprew (Season 2 winners), and Korey Gandy and Olivia Kaiser (Season 3 winners) all called it quits after the show ended. Even relationships that seemed strong during the reunion episodes eventually fizzled.
'Love Island USA' Season 5 Couples Still Together

Crowned the winners of Season 5, Hannah Wright and Marco Donatelli were a couple for Hannah's entire villa journey. The pair proved their connection was built to last, and they recently announced their engagement on Instagram.
Carsten Bergersen, aka Bergie, began his "Love Island USA" experience as an original Islander, but his journey to find love wasn't easy.

It wasn't until Day 21 when bombshell Taylor Nicole Smith entered the villa that  the stars aligned for Bergie. Not only did the couple make it to the finale, securing third place for the season, but the pair remains strong today, sharing their favorite moments together with fans on their social media.
'Love Island USA' Season 6 Couples Still Together
In a twist that shocked "Love Island" fans, JaNa Craig and Kenny Rodriguez from Season 6 have split up. Two couples from the season are still together, however.
Serena Page and Kordell Beckham's bond started slow, with both wanting to build the foundation of their relationship on friendship.
The pair remained a couple almost the entire season, except during Casa Amor, when Kordell shockingly returned to the main villa hand-in-hand with a bombshell.
The aftermath of Kordell's return from Casa was explosive, with Serena angry, heartbroken and seemingly ready to leave the relationship in the past.
Casa Amor ultimately brought the pair closer than ever. They re-coupled and claimed their status as king and queen of the villa when they were crowned the winners of Season 6 just one week later.
The couple made their relationship official in August 2024 and have been seemingly inseparable since.
Leah Kateb began her "Love Island" journey as an original Islander, but it wasn’t until bombshell Miguel Harichi entered the villa that she found her perfect match.
The pair’s relationship blossomed quickly, with both Miguel and Leah proving they were willing to fight for their connection.

The ended Season 6 as the runner-ups. The couple remains together today, regularly sharing glimpses of their relationship on social media and showing fans that their villa connection has successfully transitioned into a real-world love story.
‘Love Island USA’ Season 7 Couples Still Together

The winners of 'Love Island USA' Season 7 stole America's hearts, and they still have each others. After making their relationship exclusive on their final date during the season finale, the pair has seemingly been enjoying post-villa life together.

From throwing the opening pitch at a Boston Red Sox game to finally going on that truffle pasta date they discussed in the villa, the couple moved past breakup rumors that circled the internet soon after their "Love Island USA" win.
But their relationship status is up in the air: Amaya and Bryan unfollowed each other on Instagram ahead of the Aug. 25 reunion.

Nic Vansteenberghe and Olandria Carthen were fan favorites long before they became a couple and secured third place of "Love Island USA" Season 7, and they haven’t been shy about showcasing their post-villa romance.
Both explored strong connections with other islanders throughout the show, but fate (or production) kept drawing them back to each other.

The couple has been practically inseparable since leaving Fiji, spending their time together at cast outings, on a trip to Greece, watching “Nicolandria” ship edits of themselves during TikTok lives, and collaborating on modeling shoots.
In an exclusive interview with TODAY.com, Olandria gushed about the internet's love for her and Nic; specifically the "Nicolandria" edits.

"I love it. The edits tell our story beautifully, from beginning to end," she said. "And some of them even bring me to tears sometimes, like this is so beautiful. To know that we were unintentionally doing all this, like none of that was forced."
Perhaps one of the most surprising pairings of the season, these two bombshells are enjoying their romance outside the villa.
Iris Kendall and Jose “Pepe” Garcia-Gonzalez entered the villa together as bombshells, looking to shake up the villa and find their own connections.
Confiding in one another when their significant others were gone, Iris and Pepe realized there was more than just a friendship between them— there were romantic sparks.
Since coming in fourth place of Season 7 and leaving Fiji, the pair seems to be enjoying each other's company in their shared hometown of Los Angeles.
In an exclusive interview with TODAY.com, Pepe confirmed the status of the pair's relationship.

"I think at this point, everybody kind of knows we’re together, obviously," Pepe told TODAY.com. "They know it’s very different than normal relationships ... it’s just, continue to be with each other and focus on each other and just make sure that we can see this through."
Out of all the couples going strong since leaving Fiji, Chelley and Ace's connection has been brewing the longest.
Chelley and Olandria were the first Islanders to enter the villa on Day 1, and when Ace walked in, Chelley couldn't believe her eyes.
"Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. This can't be real life," Chelley said as Ace walked through the villa toward her and the other girls.
"I know you," Ace said as he approached Chelley, giving her a hug.
When host Ariana Madix asked Ace to clarify how he knows Chelley, he explained, "I met her in New York actually. Outside of a club, actually, yeah."
"This is crazy," Chelley replied.

And so, the season-long romance began. Though the pair clearly had a connection from the jump, they both were adamant about keeping themselves open to getting to know other people. After exploring other connections, Chelley and Ace officially coupled up.
Then came Casa Amor. True to their word, both Chelley and Ace kept exploring other connections, and both decided to re-couple with someone else when returning from the Casa Amor experiment.

Despite their explorations outside each other, there was no denying their chemistry, and the pair decided to re-couple. From then on, the pair's connection only grew, and they became exclusive during a date in the Hideaway.
Since leaving the villa, the couple has enjoyed spending time together, posting a sweet video of their day at Disneyland with the Season 7 cast on their Instagrams.
Taylor Williams and Clarke Carraway are going strong after leaving the villa.

“We’re still the same as we were in the villa,” Taylor told TODAY.com after the finale. “That’s why I used the word exclusive instead of closed off. Closed off is a villa term. You’re not in the outside world saying, ‘We’re closed off.’”

Clarke entered the show as a bombshell in Episode 19 and they connected immediately. The connection is there — but now they're facing the hurdle of long-distance. Taylor is from Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, while Clarke is from Charlotte, North Carolina.

“I’m going to go to Oklahoma and do the rodeo situation, and then he’s going to come visit me in Charlotte,” Clarke told TODAY.com. “Definitely, like a lot of traveling, but things to look forward to.”

title: Former HGTV Star and ‘Bachelorette’ Jillian Harris Marries Justin Pasutto After 13 Years Together
summary: Jillian Harris and her longtime love, Justin Pasutto, have tied the knot in not one but two "fairy tale" ceremonies
story: Jillian Harris and her longtime love, Justin Pasutto, have tied the knot in not one but two "fairy tale" ceremonies.

The former "Bachelorette" and HGTV star, 45, and her fiancé, a former pro snowboarder, tied the knot Aug. 21 in a church ceremony before saying “I do” again two days later in front of 176 guests on their farm in West Kelowna, British Columbia, People reported.

“After eight years of planning, we’ve decided to really go for it!” Harris told the publication. “It is an actual fairy-tale dream come true. I’m so happy that we waited this long so that we could truly plan the day that we’ve always dreamed of.”

The newlyweds, who have been together for 13 years, exchanged vows for the first time at the same church where Pasutto’s parents wed. Harris walked down the aisle wearing a custom-made lace wedding dress by Candé Bridal Boutique.

The couple put thought into "customizing the liturgy" so that the ceremony felt "special and personal to us as a couple and as a family,” said Harris, noting that Pasutto's Catholic faith played a "meaningful" role.
Afterward, Harris and Pasutto hosted an Italian-themed rehearsal dinner at their home to honor Pasutto's Italian roots.
The pair and their loved ones spent the following day doing yoga and golfing before they walked down the aisle again at Harris and Pasutto’s property in a "flower farm"-themed ceremony.
Harris described the ceremony's aesthetic as “timeless, elegant, and luxurious" but with a "floral touch."

“Justin has worked tirelessly over the past two years to repair the property, replanting trees, moving dirt, planting grass, irrigating and managing the team,” she said. “He has devoted the last year of his life to making my wedding venue dreams come true.”
Afterward, at the reception, the couple shared their first dance to Taylor Swift’s “Lover.”

Harris starred on Season 5 of "The Bachelorette" in 2009 before appearing as a designer on the HGTV series "Extreme Makeover: Home Edition" in 2010 and, later, as the co-host of "Love It or List It Too" from 2013 to 2019.
She met Pasutto in 2012. The couple, who got engaged on Christmas 2016, share two kids: son Leo, 9, and daughter Annie, 6.

“Well THAT was SOME Christmas morning!!!!!” Harris wrote, announcing their engagement on Instagram next to a photo of the couple in bed with their son and two dogs. “OH MY GOD my heart cannot handle this much LOVE! @slipperygoose you’ve made me the HAPPIEST girl in the world.”
“#Finally,” she added along with the hashtag “#ISimplyAskedForOneThingForChristmas.”
The couple originally planned to walk down the aisle in the summer of 2020  — with Harris' grandmother meant to be her maid of honor — but their wedding plans were thwarted by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Harris's grandmother, who passed away in 2019, still played a role in their ceremony: Harris carried her ashes in the pocket of her dress.
In June, Harris shared a video with footage from her bachelorette party, which was held at the Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge in her native Alberta, Canada, on Instagram.
"After eight years of being engaged, I finally had my Bachelorette party, and here’s how it went…,” Harris wrote in text in the clip.

The video began by showing Harris and her friends tossing cowboy hats in the air. It went on to show the group of women decorating the lodge — with a banner that read "Last Hoedown" — along with footage of them dancing and doing yoga together.
“Going back to my Alberta roots with 15 of my besties was exactly what my soul needed,” Harris wrote in her caption.

“We made so many unforgettable memories," she added. "From the yummiest food, to morning pilates and canoeing on the lake, dancing to country music, singing, belly laughing, and stories we’ll be telling for years.”

title: What Time Is the 'Love Island USA' Reunion? How to Watch
summary: The “Love Island USA” Season 7 reunion has arrived! Here's what you need to know about when the reunion is airing, how to watch and where things stand among the stars.
story: A little over a month after leaving the villa, the cast of “Love Island USA” Season 7 is getting ready to reunite.
Many of the show's cast members, including its final four couples, will be pulled for one last chat during the reunion airing on Monday, Aug. 25.

The season wrapped on July 13 when Amaya Espinal and Bryan Arenales were voted America's favorite couple, which came after six weeks of steamy romance and relationship drama among the contestants during their time in Fiji.
Since the finale, the "Love Island USA" stars have reflected on their time on the show's seventh season, which racked up the most watches of any season of a Peacock original series.
Hoping to catch the "Love Island USA" Season 7 reunion episode? Here’s all you need to know about when and where to tune in, plus what to expect ahead of the special event.
What Time Is the ‘Love Island USA’ Season 7 Reunion?
Fans can tune in for the hour-long "Love Island USA" Season 7 reunion on Monday, Aug. 25, starting at 9 p.m. ET.
How to Watch the 'Love Island USA' Season 7 Reunion
The "Love Island USA" Season 7 reunion episode will be available to watch on Peacock.
What Do We Know so Far About the Reunion?
As teased in the “Love Island USA” Season 7 reunion trailer, which dropped on Aug. 21, the stars are expected to break down never-before-seen moments from the show and hash out unresolved drama.

Co-hosts Ariana Madix and Andy Cohen will chat with the contestants about their time on the show and life after Fiji. The episode will highlight unresolved moments of tension from the season, such as its feud-fueling “Heart Rate Challenge.”

The special event airs amid rumors that two of the show’s final four couples — Amaya and Bryan, as well as Iris Kendall and Pepe Garcia-Gonzalez — may have split, fueled by fans noticing they unfollowed one another on social media ahead of the reunion.

title: 'Love Island' Stars Amaya and Bryan Unfollow Each Other Hours Before the Reunion
summary: Are Amaya Espinal and Bryan Arenales still together after winning "Love Island USA" and amid breakup rumors? Here's what we know.
story: It may not be happily ever after for our "Love Island USA" Season 7 winners Amaya Espinal and Bryan Arenales.
They emerged victorious from the Fiji villa, winning over America, each other and the $100,000 cash prize. They left the villa as a couple.
In an interview with TODAY.com soon after the finale, Bryan emphasized their relationship's authenticity: “Honestly, I’m so happy to be here with her. Trust me, it’s real."
“I’m also a bad actress and a bad liar — I think people would be able to catch on quickly,” Amaya chimed in. “I’m like, I need Botox after this, he makes me smile this much.”
Since then, though, the couple has been dogged by persistent breakup rumors that reached a fever pitch this week.
Ahead of the "Love Island USA" Season 7 Reunion, both Amaya and Bryan have unfollowed each other on Instagram, adding fuel to split speculation that first surfaced earlier this summer.
The rumors began swirling when Bryan was allegedly spotted  with another woman at a nightclub just days after the couple left the villa together.

At the time, the pair seemed to shut down the chatter with a romantic TikTok posted to Bryan’s account. “When everyone thinks you’re over meanwhile this is us,” read the caption, accompanying footage of the couple gazing into each other’s eyes before Amaya leaped into Bryan’s arms.
Based on the reunion trailer, Bryan will address the rumors. Here's what to know.
What happened between Amaya and Bryan on ‘Love Island USA’?
Amaya’s journey to find love in Fiji was far from straightforward.
Entering the villa as a bombshell on Episode 4 alongside Hannah Fields, Amaya originally coupled up with Ace Greene.
While there seemed to be a spark between the pair at first, Ace quickly switched up on Amaya, citing her usage of nicknames (particularly “babe”) and physical touch as too much, too soon.
From there, Amaya found more connections and obstacles. She coupled up with Austin Shepard on Episode 14, but he, like Ace, began to distance himself from Amaya.
The couple split up when Casa Amor happened on Episode 19, leaving them both single and open to exploring new connections.

Bryan came into the show as a bombshell in Casa Amor, the biggest relationship test of every “Love Island” season. This is where either the men or the women from the main villa are secretly whisked away to a second villa nearby, where they get to meet a group of other singles hoping to find love in Fiji.

In Casa Amor, Bryan quickly hit it off with Andreina. Amaya, meanwhile, was striking up a connection with Zak Srakaew, who also came into the show during Casa Amor. They ultimately coupled up and remained a couple as they went back to the main villa.
However, Zak blindsided Amaya during the “Stand on Business” challenge and gang up on her alongside Austin and Ace, which led to Amaya exploring new connections and hitting it off with Bryan.
Wait, what happened during the ‘Stand on Business’ challenge?
During the “Stand on Business” challenge in Episode 26, Amaya was confronted by all three men she had previously been coupled up with: Ace, Austin and Zak.
As Amaya stood in front of her peers, she read cards that had been written about her — specifically about her emotions and how she expressed herself in her relationships.
“You cry more than needed. You try to move to fast for everyone,” Austin wrote on a card that Amaya had to read in front of the entire villa.
“God forbid I’m a sensitive gangsta,” Amaya replied (a phrase that became one of her signature one-liners).

“I would just have to say that many people could view this as a weakness, but to me personally, after everything I’ve been through in my life, I view it as a strength,” she continued. “So if you guys view it like that, then guess what. I’m just not your cup of tea to be drinking, so don’t f------ drink it.”
Austin admitted to writing the card, explaining that after they initially coupled up, “the intensity of your emotions and feelings and wants just felt like they built way up.”

Ace and Zak decided to join Austin and gang up on Amaya in front of everyone. But what could have been Amaya’s lowest point in the villa actually became a silver lining, as this is where her and Bryan’s story began.

“One thing I got to add though,” Bryan interjected that night. “Coming from a Hispanic household, calling someone ‘Babe,’ ‘Mi amor,’ ‘Mi vida,’ that’s just how we talk. You’re telling her meet you halfway, you got to meet her halfway, too.”
The following day, Amaya and Bryan had a chat and started to get to know one another. Bryan not only understood Amaya, but he loved the way she expressed herself.

The pair coupled up on Episode 30, and America eventually voted to send them to the Season 7 finale. Viewers got to see their final date and declarations of love, the loving speeches all the final couples give to one another right before the winners are announced.
During their first and final date, Amaya expressed her appreciation for Bryan, especially for how he spoke on her behalf during the “Stand on Business” challenge.

“Babe, you don’t understand how much it meant, that moment, like of you standing up for me in the Stand on Business,” she told him. “You know, like, if my light is too bright for somebody, wear sunglasses or something.”
“But with you, you looked right into the sun, you know?” she continued.
Bryan “popped the question,” as Amaya put it in her confessional later in the episode, to continue dating exclusively each other when they leave Fiji.
“I just wanted to talk to you and just basically let you know how much I care about you and how much you mean to me here,” he said.

“And I love your energy, I love when you get the zoomies ... Just making everybody’s day better. Fine as hell ... I definitely wanted to leave here letting you know that I want to make stuff exclusive with us and prioritize us. I want to continue taking the right steps with you and attacking the outside world with you.”
Are Amaya and Bryan still together now?
The couple publicly confirmed their exclusive relationship after leaving the villa and during a recent profile with TODAY.com. Amaya said she visited Bryan's family in Boston.
“I had such a great time, met his mom — it was just very wholesome,” Amaya said.
But their decision to unfollow each other on Instagram signals serious trouble in paradise.
Adding to the breakup speculation, Amaya reposted a cryptic TikTok video the same day fans noticed the social media snub.

The video says, "How it feels when you know you have to leave him alone," over pictures of  girls crying, alone, or looking forlornly. The caption features a few hashtags, including "#ex," "#sad," and "#imissyou."

title: Why 'Love Island' Drama Continues After the Show, According to a Psychologist
summary: Expert reveals how Love Island's isolated environment affects contestants' mental health, decision-making, and relationships through psychological manipulation.
story: Joining "Love Island" may seem like the ultimate dream gig — a trip to Fiji where you bask in the sun all day surrounded by attractive singles, playing what amounts to glorified frat party games with no real-world distractions. Just you, your best bathing suits, and endless tropical sunshine.
But behind this Instagram-perfect facade is a intense psychological experiment.

The hit reality dating show strips participants of modern life's most basic comforts — no personal phones, no clocks, little privacy — creating conditions that could fundamentally alter how they think, feel and form relationships.

TODAY.com spoke with Beverley Andre, a licensed psychologist, about how the villa's unique environment could affect contestants' minds and decision-making processes, and why the show has mental health care professionals on set.
Her insights reveal why "Love Island USA" relationships can appear and feel so intense in the moment, yet may struggle to survive in the real world.
When Time Stands Still
Perhaps the most disorienting aspect of villa life is the complete absence of time cues. Without clocks or calendars, contestants lose all sense of how long they've actually known each other.
"When time is distorted, your day can feel like a week," Andre says. "So you're thinking that you have this really deep bond with this person, but it's only been like one day or two days."

This temporal confusion accelerates emotional investment in ways that can seem almost comical to viewers. Remember when contestants declare they’re “ready to be locked in” after just 48 hours? That’s not just reality TV drama — it’s psychology in action.
“There’s no indication, no cues for you to remember, ‘You guys just got here. This is brand new,’” Andre says.
The result? Some decisions can be driven more by proximity rather than compatibility.
While "Love Island's" relatively tech-free environment might sound like a wellness retreat, it brings both benefits and challenges for contestants.
On the positive side, the absence of digital transactions allows for unprecedented focus.
"When you aren't surrounded by so much noise, you're able to center in and really focus on your own thoughts," Andre says.
Forced introspection can lead to genuine self-discovery and deeper connections.

However, the isolation comes with a major downside: Contestants lose access to established neutral parties. Without the outside perspectives people in the real world often engage with when dating, contestants can become trapped in their own biases and misconceptions.
“You don’t have neutral sounding boards because technically, the other people there are your competitors,” Andre explains.
When Romance Meets Competition

The villa's unique blend of romantic pursuit and competition creates what Andre calls a "pressure pot effect." Contestants aren't just looking for love, they're fighting for public votes and a cash prize, which fundamentally changes relationship dynamics.
“'How can you gain the fastest connection possible?' becomes the driving question, rather than, 'Is this person right for me?'” Andre says.

The format of the show — and the $100,000 cash prize at the end — can lead people to pursue a relationship for the sake of appearing to be in a strong connection, as opposed to laying the groundwork for a relationship.

(The show aims to "test" these motives at the end by forcing one member of the winning couple to decide whether they split the prize money or keep it for themselves, with the goal of proving whether or not they were in the villa for love.)

The constant questioning of motives adds another layer of complexity. As Andre points out, both contestants and viewers, may wonder: “Are you really digging me, or do you just want us to win and look cute?”
Living Under Surveillance
Sharing one bedroom and one bathroom with a house full of strangers, all while being filmed 24/7, would create unprecedented challenges for emotional regulation, Andre says.
"When you have a hard day at work, sometimes you just need space and time to process without having witnesses,” Andre says. “But then you can’t, because you have eyes all around you.”

The lack of privacy doesn't just affect comfort. It can actively shape behavior. Contestants must constantly consider how their actions will be perceived by both their fellow Islanders and the viewing public. The result can be emotional shutdown rather than emotional regulation.

For contestants from marginalized groups, this scrutiny carries additional weight. Black women on the show face particular pressure around public perception, which can affect everything from their romantic choices to their physical expressions of affection, Andre says.
“Black women can’t go on this show and sleep with any of these people or any of these men, because of the public perception around Black women and being overly sexualized,” Andre says.
She cites contestants Olandria Carthen and Chelley Bissainthe, who appeared on Keke Palmer's podcast, "Baby, This is Keke Palmer," on July 22 and spoke to this perception.
During the episode, Palmer asked the former Islanders how often they feel they had to "tone down" their emotions and reactions to events in the villa as Black women.

"It's taken out of context, and I'm a bad guy and I'm a mean girl," Olandria responded. "It’s very exhausting to say the least. I truly feel like initially I had to tone down a lot to not cross over that boundary because a person that looks the opposite of us, as soon as they get emotional it’s like, ‘Oh, we’re going to cater to this person.’ It’s like bro, what about us? I don’t understand."
The 'Challenges'

While "Love Island" occasionally includes what Andre calls "wholesome activities" that can mirror real relationship milestones, such as family day, some viewers are here for prime reality TV drama. Enter: the challenges.

While many feature elaborate props, costumes and kissing, some can expose interpersonal rifts. For example, the "Stand on Business" challenge encouraged contestants to anonymously call out other Islanders, while “Hate to Burst Your Bubble" involved Islanders sorting each other in categories like "most genuine," before revealing how viewers at home ranked them.

Andre says while these challenges are entertaining for the viewer, they can cause emotional harm to the islanders participating in them. She uses Season 7's infamous Heart Rate challenge, which involves Islanders dressing in costume and acting out to try and raise their fellow contestants' heart rates the most, as an example.
"These situations — do they really have the time to process?" Andre says. "Granted, they’re with each other 24 hours a day, but do they have the capacity and the space to process?"
The Heart Rate challenge led to a feud between Huda Mustafa and Chelley, after several people in the villa thought Huda went too far while dancing with Ace, the other half of Chelley's couple.

"'Wow, we just had this experience, and I’m in this relationship, but there are some things that happened in that challenge that made me feel, you know, really jealous, or I felt very humiliated,'" Andre explains of how Islanders may process these situations. "'You’re saying that you’re really feeling me, or you love me, but then someone else was kissing up on you, and I don’t know how to react to that, right?'"
Reality Check: Transitioning Back to the Real World

Perhaps the most significant psychological challenge may come after the cameras stop rolling, when contestants must process an intense, highly controlled experience while navigating new relationships under public scrutiny.
“They’re still processing the whole experience,” Andre says.
The villa’s emotional intensity, combined with challenges that may have triggered feelings of jealousy or humiliation, would require serious psychological work to unpack.
Add in the pressures of newfound fame, social media attention and public investment in their relationships, and it’s no wonder "Love Island" couples can struggle post-villa.
“If they’re really down for the cause and down for the relationship, I would imagine they’re in therapy,” Andre says.

title: Who Is Jussie Smollett's Fiancé? All About Jabari Redd
summary: Who is Jussie Smollett's fiance? What has Jussie Smollett said about his sexuality?
story: Jussie Smollett has a special someone in his life.

The "Empire" star got engaged to actor Jabari Redd earlier this year. The couple announced the happy news in a June Instagram post, sharing photos of the moment that Smollett popped the question in Florence, Italy.
Smollett penned the caption, “I’ll be spending my birthday with my Fiancé… He said YES.”
Smollett first addressed his sexuality in 2015, when his “Empire” character, Jamal Lyon, came out as gay.
Smollett, in an appearance on The Ellen DeGeneres Show, declined to talk about his personal life in detail. But in a backstage interview with DeGeneres filmed on camera, he came out.
“There is no closet. There’s never been a closet ... I don’t talk about my personal life but that is in no way to deny or hide who God made me,” he said.
A later, in a 2016 interview with Out magazine, Smollett talked about his sexuality and outright said he identifies as a gay man.

“God, I’ve never had to talk about this, so I’m trying to find the words. If I had to label myself, I would label myself as a gay man," he said. "With that said, I believe that love is the only thing that matters, and I would hope that anybody would leave themselves open — not to gender, but to love."

Smollett's fiancé does not appear in the new Netflix documentary in which Smollett, Chicago law enforcement and more speak about Smollett's alleged hate crime hoax. This is the first time Smollett has spoken about the incident since a 2019 interview with Robin Roberts.
Scroll below to learn more about Smollett's fiancé's Jabari Redd.
Jabari Redd is an actor and music producer
According to his IMDb page, Redd started his acting career in 2012 when he played Damon Boy in "Tyler Perry's House of Payne."
He also had a five-episode arc as Deondray in Lena Waithe's series "The Chi."
Redd has produced music videos for Soulja Boy, such as “She Make It Clap” and “Rick & Morty.”
Redd and Smollett have worked together
Redd appeared in Smollett's directorial debut “B-Boy Blues," an LGBTQ+ romance that came out in 2021.
Smollett and Redd co-starred in another movie Smollett directed, "The Lost Holliday" (2024). They play a married couple in the film.
He attended Morehouse College and Hampton University
According to the official website of Morehouse Athletics, Redd attended Morehouse College after he transferred over from Hampton University.
At Morehouse, he was on the dean's list and ran track and field. He minored in biology, journalism and sports and planned to "work with NFL/ NBA teams as a physician" after he graduated.

On the website, he described himself as an "easy, outgoing person" with three siblings, who enjoyed listening to music by Kanye West, Nerd and Jay-Z. He also said his favorite movies are "Finding Nemo," "Baby Mama," "Precious" and "Friday."
He's from New York
Redd is from Long Island, New York, according to his track and field biography at Morehouse College. Redd and Smollett visited New York earlier this year, per Redd's Instagram.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Should Sophie and Margo End Up Together on ’The Hunting Wives’? Author May Cobb Weighs In
summary: "The Hunting Wives" author May Cobb weighs in on viral theories about the book and how it came to be. She also comments on Margo and Sophie's relationship.
story: "The Hunting Wives" is now a Netflix phenomenon, a star-studded series about southern housewives behaving badly — and they're packing more than booze and gossip.

But it all began with a story author May Cobb's mother told her once, while they were driving down the blacktop roads of Longview, her Texas hometown. Cobb's eventual 2021 novel, "The Hunting Wives," went on to inspire the series, first produced for Starz.

"My mom is such a good storyteller. She started telling me how in high school some of the rich boys would invite her to something called 'the hunting party,'" Cobb says, speaking to TODAY.com. "Basically, they would go out to the roofs of their giant cars and try to shoot small game."
Cobb, hearing the story, immediately thought of everything that could go wrong with the scenario, and there was a lot. Then it clicked: She wanted to write a novel about it.
"But I want to swap out the rich boys for women. I want to subvert to 'Texas boys club' and let the women behave badly for a change," she remembers thinking.

It's the story of Sophie (Brittany Snow in the series), a Texas transplant who becomes enmeshed in a dynamic friend group in her new town. When a teenage girl winds up dead, they're implicated, although the ending in Cobb's novel is different.

Cobb set the story in a town like the one she grew up in, two hours east of Dallas, in a part of Texas close to the Louisiana border. She describes it as "eerily beautiful noir," a place where Spanish moss hangs from trees and everyone knows everyone's name and history.

She calls the character of Margo, portrayed by Malin Åkerman in the show, a risk-taking and boundary-pushing woman whom Sophie befriends, an "archetypal east Texas woman" in the book, but also in the show.

"It's a party town. The people from my town are high-spirited and fun. I remember one of my editor's notes was, 'Do people drink this much?' And I said, 'I actually toned it down,'" she says, laughing.

She wanted the book to feel like a "train wreck" and a "downward spiral." She was writing when her son was a little kid, and since she was no longer going out for ladies' nights, put the feeling of nights out in the book.
"I think I went a little too far, but it was so much fun to, like, skew that moral compass and not have to worry about it at all," she says.
Cobb stands by her book's morally gray female characters, who party until the late hours and have affairs with high schoolers — and each other.

“I got a fair amount of backlash when the book came out, and I was honestly shocked. I was like, ‘Wow, that’s not why I read novels. I read them to escape, to go on an adventure, and I love a good train wreck,’” she says. “I feel like, ‘Who am I to judge?’”
“It’s funny. Nobody ever got mad at the women being murderers. They were mad about the misbehaving,” she says.
She no longer lives in Longview, Texas, but she knows people in the town are theorizing about how real people might have inspired the book.

"I've heard there's group chats. And I'm like, 'Guys, I'm a professional author. These characters are fictional.' I'm not foolish enough to write about anyone that's real from there," she says, laughing. (The landscape continues to inspire her: Her upcoming book, "All the Little Houses," is set in Longview.)
'Hunting Wives' Author May Cobb Weighs in on Fan Theories — Including About Sophie and Margo
Speaking of theories: Since the series's first season dropped, there have been many. Cobb is an executive producer for the show, but even then, some of the theories surprise her.

THEORY: Sophie fired the kill shot at Abby. Then Margo finished the job. "My knee-jerk reaction would be to say, 'No, it was Margo.' But that's kind of fun." THEORY: Jill hit Abby with her car, which is why she was limping. "Wow. Interesting. Hm. Well, all of this could be such good fodder for Season 2. I don't even know where this part of the internet lives."THEORY: Sophie is reading a book on her nightstand called 'The Wide Window,' a Lemony Snicket book about someone being watched. Is she being watched? "I feel like that's just a happy accident with, like, that's her son's book. That's just me, though that's a really clever — I love all this."THEORY: Graham (played by Evan Jonigkeit in the show) did not leave Sophie: He was abducted. "No, absolutely not. He was not abducted."
THEORY: Sophie fired the kill shot at Abby. Then Margo finished the job. "My knee-jerk reaction would be to say, 'No, it was Margo.' But that's kind of fun."

THEORY: Jill hit Abby with her car, which is why she was limping. "Wow. Interesting. Hm. Well, all of this could be such good fodder for Season 2. I don't even know where this part of the internet lives."

THEORY: Sophie is reading a book on her nightstand called 'The Wide Window,' a Lemony Snicket book about someone being watched. Is she being watched? "I feel like that's just a happy accident with, like, that's her son's book. That's just me, though that's a really clever — I love all this."
THEORY: Graham (played by Evan Jonigkeit in the show) did not leave Sophie: He was abducted. "No, absolutely not. He was not abducted."
There is one theory, however, she agrees with, and it's about the nature of Margo and Sophie's relationship. Many "Hunting Wives" fans are rooting for Sophie and Margo's romance.
Cobb is, too. "I do hope they wind up together and ride off into the sunset," she says. "Margo and Sophie forever. Why not?"
She's hoping for a Season 2 of the show. But for now, she's enjoying where she landed.

This book was her “Hail Mary pass,” coming at a crossroads, when she felt like she was at the end of her writing career. She wrote it in a four-month “state of euphoria,” not plotting it out but rather letting the story carry her. Since then, Cobb has published three books.
"Those wicked women have been the gift that keeps giving. God bless the hunting wives," she says.

title: Norman Reedus’ Son, Mingus Reedus, 25, Charged with Assault
summary: The son of “Walking Dead” star Norman Reedus was arrested and charged after an alleged assault in New York City on Saturday, Aug.
story: The son of “Walking Dead” star Norman Reedus was arrested and charged after an alleged assault in New York City on Saturday, Aug. 23.

Mingus Reedus, 25, was charged with third-degree assault, assault recklessly causing injury, criminal obstruction of breathing, second-degree harassment and aggravated harassment, court records show. He pleaded not guilty on all five counts Aug. 23.

The New York Police Department said Mingus Reedus was arrested after officers responded to an assault in progress in the Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan. Upon arrival, police found a woman, 33, with “minor injuries to the neck and leg.” The woman was transported to an area hospital in stable condition, police said.
Mingus Reedus’ attorney Priya Chaudhry said in a statement to NBC News, "As the facts emerge, his innocence will become clear."

“Despite what the prosecutor said in court—which is not evidence—they chose to charge Mingus with misdemeanors or less. This speaks volumes, and much louder than the unsupported prosecutor’s in-court comments,” she said.
Chaudhry added the judge "released Mingus on his own recognizance, with neither bail nor supervision."
Norman Reedus shares son Mingus Reedus with model Helena Christensen. He also has a daughter, Nova, with partner Diane Kruger.

In 2021, Mingus Reedus, who was then 21, was charged with misdemeanor assault after a 24-year-old woman accused him of punching her in the face at the San Gennaro festival in Manhattan's Little Italy neighborhood, "E! News" reported.

At the time, he told the New York Daily News that the woman  and her friends bumped into his group of friends at the festival. He said he “threw his arm out” to protect himself and hit the woman in the process.
At the time, his attorney called the charges "baseless" in a statement to People. In 2022, he accepted a plea deal, People reported.

title: Morgan Wallen Joins List of Artists Withdrawing Their Names From Grammy Consideration
summary: Morgan Wallen has decided his Billboard 200 No. 1 album won't be in the running for a 2026 Grammy Award, joining a list of artists who have boycotted the potential accolade.
story: Morgan Wallen has decided his Billboard 200 No. 1 album won't be in the running for a 2026 Grammy Award, joining a list of artists who have boycotted the potential accolade.
Representatives for Wallen confirmed to TODAY.com that the country music artist will not submit his latest album, “I’m the Problem,” for consideration at the 68th Grammys.
Wallen's album, which contains a whopping 37 songs, has sat at the top of Billboard 200 for 11 nonconsecutive weeks, marking the third time his album has hit No. 1 on the charts.
While Wallen hasn't spoken publicly about the decision, the singer has a controversial history with award shows.
The first round of voting for the Grammys runs Oct. 3-15, with nominations set to be announced Nov. 7. The Grammys will be held Feb. 1, 2026.
Why Is Morgan Wallen Removing His Album ‘I’m the Problem’ From Grammy Consideration?
Wallen has not publicly spoken about removing his name from Grammys consideration as of Aug. 25.
While the artist remains popular among country music fans and has had numerous No. 1 hits, Wallen has never won a Grammy and has only received two nominations.

At the 67th Grammy Awards, Wallen was nominated for his duet with Post Malone, “I Had Some Help,” for best country duo/group performance and best country song. Wallen has never been nominated for any work on his solo albums.
Wallen's controversial history and legal complications, however, have also led to some fraught relationships with award shows and his record label.

In 2020, Wallen was seen in videos partying without a mask amid the Covid-19 pandemic, violating restrictions at the time. He had been schedule to perform as the musical guest on “Saturday Night Live,” but was pulled from the spot after the videos surfaced. He was later rescheduled.
Months later in 2021, TMZ shared a video of a person who appeared to be Wallen using a racial slur. After the video surfaced, Wallen was suspended from his recording label, Big Loud Records.
Thereafter, Wallen issued an apology obtained by NBC News.

“I’m embarrassed and sorry. I used an unacceptable and inappropriate racial slur that I wish I could take back,” Wallen said. “There are no excuses to use this type of language, ever. I want to sincerely apologize for using the word. I promise to do better.”
That year, Wallen was banned from attending the 2021 Billboard Music Awards, as well as the American Music Awards. The Grammys, however, never disqualified Wallen from being nominated.
He has since been welcomed back to the ACM and CMA shows.
What Artists Have Removed Their Names from Grammy Considerations?
Drake has declined to submit his music for Grammy consideration for several years while also pointedly telling his fellow musicians that the award “doesn’t dictate s---- in our world.”

But Drake has had a longstanding history with the National Academy of Recording Arts & Sciences, receiving five Grammys and 55 nominations over the years. He also served as both performer and presenter prior to his critiques.

The “Family Matters” rapper’s criticism of the Grammys began in 2017, when his hit “Hotline Bling” won best rap song and best rap/sung performance. Drake slammed the Grammys for categorizing the song as rap, as opposed to pop.

“I’m a Black artist, I’m apparently a rapper, even though ‘Hotline Bling’ is not a rap song,” Drake said during in an interview with U.K. DJ Semtex. “The only category that they can manage to fit me in is in a rap category, maybe because I’ve rapped in the past or because I’m black. I can’t figure out why.”

In 2019, the last time Drake attended the Grammys, he accepted the award for best rap song for “God’s Plan” and gave a pointed acceptance speech about how he and the other artists there that night “play in an opinion-based sport, not a factual-based sport.”

After his album “Certified Lover Boy” was nominated in 2022 for best rap album and his single “Way 2 Sexy” was nominated for best rap performance, Drake asked the Recording Academy to remove his work from the nominations. The Academy honored Drake’s request and the rapper didn’t attend the awards show.

In 2023, although Drake refused to submit his 2022 album, “Honestly, Nevermind,” or any of its songs for consideration by the Grammys, he received four nominations. Once again, however, Drake boycotted the awards show.

In 2024, Drake received four Grammy nominations for his joint 2022 album with 21 Savage, “Her Loss.” Per the Grammys, Drake “submitted material for nomination for the 2024 GRAMMYs,” but the rapper, who did not attend that year, ultimately did not take home an award.
The Weeknd has also had a winding history with the Grammys, receiving 14 nominations and four wins over the years.
After his his “Blinding Lights” and “After Hours” were snubbed from nominations at the 2021 ceremony, The Weeknd announced he would not submit his work to Recording Academy.
He told The New York Times at the time that he will “no longer allow my label to submit my music to the Grammys” due to “secret committees” involved in the nomination process.

From 2022 to 2024, the singer boycotted the award show, until an unexpected return this past year, when the Weeknd sang “Cry For Me” and “Timeless” with Playboi Carti from his new album, “Hurry Up Tomorrow.”

Irish singer-songwriter and activist Sinéad O’Connor first performed at the Grammys in 1989, just two years before writing an open letter to the Recording Academy, criticizing “false and destructive materialistic values.”
